result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob Elijah Garcia

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Discharge Report 10-24-2022

Defendant Jacob E Garcia in court.  Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr. appeared by video for Jacob E Garcia.  Attorney Michael Staskunas appeared in court. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests another status date.  Court set a soft plea date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jacob E Garcia in court with Attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests another status date.  Court set date as requested.  This matter will be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 08-09-2022

Defendant Jacob E Garcia in court with attorney Avery L Goodrich.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in Court for a status conference.  Defense requests another status date.  Court set the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 06-14-2022

Defendant Jacob E Garcia in court with Attorney Avery L Goodrich appeared via zoom.   Michael Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status conference.  Defense request a additional status conference to allow time to contact prior counsel for discovery.  Defense counsel will be come counsel of record for 21cf4178 and 21cf4903.  The court will grant defense request and the matter adjourned back to Branch 40.
  Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 05-19-2022.

Defendant Jacob Elijah Garcia in court with Attorney Avery L Goodrich; both appear by video.  Defendant Jacob Elijah Garcia in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 21CF4903, 21CF4178 & 20CF3294. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer Thoa Vue. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Miguel R.; The McDonald's Restaurant located at 1940 S. 19th Street, Milwaukee, Wisconsin

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Jacob Elijah Garcia in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Jacob Elijah Garcia in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jacob Elijah Garcia appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
